programmes.show_description: Dermot visits Kinsale in Co Cork, known as the gourmet capital of Ireland, learning about that quintessential Irish ingredient seaweed and taking a chocolate-making masterclass. He then goes foraging for wild garlic before putting together a dish inspired by his travels, with help from a Michelin-starred chef
News, sport and weather from across Scotland

Jeremy is joined in Hong Kong by fellow chef and friend Simon Rimmer as they step into the kitchen to put their own spin on an indulgent prawn toast sandwich, tour the city's old town, and make a pit stop at the city's oldest noodle factory. Jeremy also takes Simon to the hills on a morning cycle ride that is followed by a beachside barbecue where they cook vegetables, chicken wings and pork using Jeremy's secret sauce
Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features
Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.
A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions
Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews
The key headlines from the day so far

David Dickinson and his team are in Solihull, West Midlands. Simon Schneider falls in love with a vintage political poster and the Millennium Falcon lands in the den. One seller excitedly cashes in her collection of silver for a new set of wardrobes and a family hopes their battered old violin can make enough money at auction to pay for a trip to Australia

Quiz hosted by Ranvir Singh in which Steve and Jo, Mordecai and Sam, and Chloe and Beth take on Riddlemaster Henry Lewis. They attempt to answer general knowledge questions and confusing conundrums, with only one team making it through to the high-stakes final with a chance to win a cash prize

Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

Bradley Walsh presents as Dianne from Newcastle, Stephen from Essex, Adrian from Cockermouth and Meli from Berkshire pit their wits against one of the Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught
A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world
Adil Ray hosts the game of words as Countdown's Rachel Riley and radio host Richie Anderson take on screen stars Lesley Joseph and Claire Sweeney in a battle to win big money for charity
Ray's funeral causes concerns, while Vinny is worried about his love life and Kim orders Graham to leave
Bernie tells Kit about Mal's stalking, Shona mislays her wedding ring, Ben takes Tim and Steve on an outing, and Christina and Adam cause headaches for George

Elisa is late to pick up her daughter Lucia from school when Rebecca, the mother of Lucia's new friend, suggests a sleepover for the girls. However, when Elisa goes to pick Lucia up the next morning, she discovers her daughter is missing. Thriller, starring Denise Gough and Holliday Grainger
A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents
Current affairs show tackling the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective, with studio debate and analysis of major stories

Political magazine show hosted by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme

programmes.show_name: Online Reviews: Can You Trust Them? - Tonight
programmes.show_description: Online reviews can play a crucial role in guiding spending decisions, but how much can we really believe the glowing praise and five-star ratings? Sam Leader investigates the digital marketplace, a world where unscrupulous traders write their own testimonials and positive reviews can be bought in bulk

Ainsley Harriott tours John Watling's Distillery in Nassau and enjoys a taste or two of rum, then visits Graycliff restaurant for a conch chowder before making a trip to an island rum cake factory for some inspired extra ingredients for a Bahamian mama tiramisu
Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programmes.show_name: Gary Barlow's Wine Tour: South Africa
programmes.show_description: Gary and his friend Eliot Kennedy head to the Babylonstoren Wine Estate where they're put to work by the chief winemaker and the resident gardener. On the famous Franschhoek Wine Tram, Gary is joined by wildlife presenter Michaela Strachan as they get up close and personal with the local seals before meeting a Cape Town jazz legend for a home cooked meal and an exclusive musical performance

David Dickinson and his team are in Bradford with the show's biggest cash offer of £18,500. A set of Georg Jensen spoons pays for flying lessons, Alison Chapman snaps up a Hornby train set for her husband's steam railway museum, and Tim Hogarth is given a lesson in haggling by a young seller for a collection of film posters

programmes.show_description: The case of Wayne Coventry, who sought love after 18 years with his childhood sweetheart, but the 37-year-old father-of-three was involved in a toxic relationship and was murdered in October 2019

programmes.show_name: Rising Scams: What You Need To Know - Tonight
programmes.show_description: Scammers are deploying ever more sophisticated methods to steal our money. What warning signs should we watch for, and how are authorities tackling fraud? Paul Brand investigates
